original_title: Parents face hardships as VAT hike bites into education cost, Teachers Union warns
original_body_lines: General Secretary of the Ceylon Teachers' Union Joseph Stalin said that parents will face severe hardships in providing education to children, as a result of the VAT hike of 18%.

He pointed out that parents are already bearing the burden of providing proper education to their children amidst the economic situation and prevailing cost of living, and taxing them is only going to worsen the situation.
He demanded the government to resign instead of further pushing the people into an abyss.
